content: dedham square by jacqui goulbourn difficulty level intermediate terminology us terms skills required front post and back post stitches clusters and bobbles yarn any weight of yarn according to the required size of the finished square the sample is shown in stylecraft special dk hook size to achieve gauge size 12 inch square in worsted weight yarn 8 5 inches in dk weight introduction this is the november 2023 main square for ravelry s block a month bam cal come join in a fun and enthusiastic group making as many or as few squares as you like i have used stylecraft special dk in a apricot b shrimp c lemon and d saffron and e copper dedham is a picturesque village popular with tourists it is on the river stour which separates essex and suffolk with walking rowing boats and paddle boarding being popular activities it is also home to the alfred munnings art museum abbreviations repeat s repeat s bpdc back post double_crochet round s round s bphdc back post half_double_crochet single_crochet single_crochet chain chain stitch skip skip chain-space chain space slip_stitch slip_stitch double_crochet double_crochet space s space s half_double_crochet half_double_crochet st s stitch es fpdc front post double_crochet treble_crochet treble_crochet fptr front post treble_crochet wide v st double_crochet chain 2 double_crochet in same st catkitbob designs november 2023 page 1 of 6 dedham square instructions notes - the 1st double_crochet of each round can be worked either as chain 3 or standing double_crochet for 1st half_double_crochet chain 2 or standing half_double_crochet this also applies when starting a round with a v st - finish each round by joining to the top of the first st of the round - colour changes are indicated in 2nd column there are not specific instructions to finish off each colour - depending on your gauge some rnds may not lie flat but later rnds will correct this rrnndd col instructions shape total our at end stitches of round set a chain 4 join with slip_stitch to form a ring or work magic_ring up 1 a chain 1 does not count as st 8 single_crochet in ring circle 8 single_crochet 2 a 2 double_crochet in each st around circle 16 double_crochet 3 a chain 1 does not count as st *single_crochet skip 1 chain 2* repeat from * to * circle 8 single_crochet 8 chain- 7 more times space 4 b working behind round 3 *wide v st in round 2 st not worked in round circle 8 v st 8 3 chain 2* repeat from * to * 7 more times chain-space 5 c *single_crochet in chain-space of round 4 between 2 wide v sts treble_crochet into round 3 single_crochet single_crochet circle 8 v st 16 in same chain-space of round 4 then from behind round 4 pull through round single_crochet 8 treble_crochet 3 chain and work wide v st around this chain* repeat from * to * 7 more times 6 d joining to the end part of the wide v
